articles.author: Ali Sawafta, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed 14 Palestinians during a raid in the occupied West Bank on Saturday, while an ambulance driver was killed as he went to pick up wounded from a separate attack by violent Jewish settlers, Palestinian authorities said.
articles.title: More than 14 Palestinians killed as violence flares in West Bank

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: The Israeli settlers who rampaged through the West Bank village of al-Mughayyer on April 12 came in greater numbers and carried more weapons than during any of the previous raids on the Palestinian community, residents said.
articles.title: West Bank village counts losses after settler attack, and fears more

articles.author: Mohammad Salem, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: A baby girl was delivered from the womb of a Palestinian killed along with her husband and daughter by an Israeli attack in the Gaza city of Rafah, where 19 people died overnight in intensified strikes, Palestinian health officials said.
articles.title: Baby in Gaza saved from womb of mother killed in Israeli strike

articles.author: Cordelia Hsu
articles.description: Hundreds gathered on Sydney's Bondi Beach on Sunday evening, lighting candles as the sun set, to mourn the six people killed in a knife attack in the area's Westfield shopping mall a week ago.
articles.title: Hundreds gather on Sydney's Bondi Beach to mourn Westfield attack victims

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's State Attorney on Sunday indicted the sister of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh on charges of incitement and showing solidarity with a terror group, after she allegedly praised Hamas' Oct. 7 attack that sparked the six-month old war in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel indicts sister of Hamas leader Haniyeh on terrorism incitement

articles.author: Borja Suarez
articles.description: Thousands of people protested in Tenerife on Saturday, calling for the Spanish island to temporarily limit tourist arrivals to stem a boom in short-term holiday rentals and hotel construction that is driving up housing costs for locals.
articles.title: Thousands protest in Spain's Canary Islands over mass tourism

articles.author: Bernard Orr, Ethan Wang
articles.description: Major rivers, waterways and reservoirs in China's Guangdong province are threatening to unleash dangerous floods, forcing the government on Sunday to enact emergency response plans to protect more than 127 million people.
articles.title: Massive river flooding expected in China's Guangdong, threatening millions

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Sunday welcomed the passage of $60 billion aid for Ukraine by the U.S. House of Representatives but urged Washington to quickly turn the bill into law and proceed with the actual transfer of weapons, saying long-range arms and air defense systems were top priorities.
articles.title: Zelenskiy urges speedy passage of Ukraine aid in US Senate, transfer of weapons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Saturday that U.S. House of Representatives' approval of security aid to Ukraine would lead to more damage and deaths in the conflict there.
articles.title: Aid bill's passage will hurt Ukraine, cause more deaths, Kremlin says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Most Serbs in volatile north Kosovo boycotted a local referendum on Sunday on whether to remove ethnic Albanian mayors in four municipalities whose appointment led to violence last year, the country's election commission said.
articles.title: North Kosovo Serbs boycott referendum on removing ethnic Albanian mayors
